steps: If anticoagulation safe, start therapeutic Lovenox or heparin
Assess for signs/symptoms (cough, dysuria, redness, etc)
Order UA and chest X-ray if no clear source
Start empiric antibiotics if clinically indicated
Ask patient to localize pain and describe character
Review vitals for red flags (fever, tachycardia)
Consider labs/imaging if unexplained or severe
Trial PRN meds (acetaminophen, topical agents, opioids if appropriate)
Ask last bowel movement, assess abdominal symptoms
Review current regimen (Senna, docusate, Miralax, etc)
Escalate stepwise: add suppository, then enema if needed
Check KUB if no response and abdominal pain/bloating
